member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers
member.summary: Helper class to call asynchronous methods from synchronous ones. You shouldn't do this normally, but sometimes, you have to. Taken from here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5095183/how-would-i-run-an-async-taskt-method-synchronously

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.RunSync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Execute's an async Task{T} method which has a void return value synchronously

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.RunSync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Action{System.Action,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Execute's an async Task{T} method which has a void return value synchronously

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.RunSync``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Execute's an async Task{T} method which has a T return type synchronously

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.RunSync``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},System.Action{System.Action,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Execute's an async Task{T} method which has a T return type synchronously

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.RunCancelableAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Int32)
member.summary: Run a task which can be canceled. If cancelation detected throws OperationCanceledException.
member.param: thread sleep time before next status check

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.RunCancelableAsync``1(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Runs a task and allows cancellation at any time.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncHelpers.Yield
member.summary: Creates an awaitable task that asynchronously yields back to the current context when awaited

member.summary: The sync root.

member.summary: The tasks.

member.summary: The token.

member.summary: The token source.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.#ctor
member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created. Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Instance
member.summary: Get instance of BackgroundThreadManager.
member.remarks: The call to this property is thread-safe.

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.CancellationToken
member.summary: Gets cancellation token.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Reset
member.summary: Reset instance of BackgroundThreadManager

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.AbortAll
member.summary: Aborts all currently running background tasks.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes specified task.
member.remarks: This method must be called in order to release a finished tasks.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Start(System.Action)
member.summary: Starts specified action in new background task.
member.param: Action to start in a background task.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Wait(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits for specified task.
member.param: OPTIONAL: Number of milliseconds to wait. Default is -1 (wait infinitely).
member.returns: True if the Task completed execution within the allotted time; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Propagates unhandled exceptions occured within task by throwing an AggregateException.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of tasks.

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Common.AsyncTaskManager.WaitForAll
member.summary: Waits for all registered background thread to be finished.

member.summary: Gets the format string for standard format. Use this to make sure all display strings are formatted identically and the format can be changed at a central location (OLCF).

member.summary: Gets the format string for a display friendly iso format.

member.summary: Gets the format string that specifies standard format date display.
